claim-text.content: 1. A method of facilitating recovery from a failure of a proxy call session control function within an IP multimedia subsystem network, the method comprising the steps of:

monitoring, in a gateway of a packet switched access network used by a user equipment to access the IP multimedia subsystem network, signals arriving at the gateway from the proxy call session control function;
providing an indication in the gateway if the monitored signals become unacceptable; and

performing an action in the gateway, in response to the indication, which signals the unavailability of the proxy call session control function to the user equipment which is associated with the proxy call session control function;
wherein the providing step provides the indication in response to an interruption in the monitored signals;
wherein the providing step provides the indication after a predetermined delay from receipt of the monitored signals; and
wherein the predetermined delay is a function of signal traffic level from the user equipment via the gateway intended for the proxy call session control function.

claim.body: which the user equipment responds to the action by performing a re-registration with the IP multimedia subsystem including associating the user equipment with another proxy call session control function.

content: , in which the user equipment responds to the action by performing a re-registration with the IP multimedia subsystem including associating the user equipment with another proxy call session control function.

claim.body: which the monitoring step comprises monitoring, in the gateway, signals arriving at the gateway from each proxy call session control function whose address is stored at the gateway.

content: , in which the monitoring step comprises monitoring, in the gateway, signals arriving at the gateway from each proxy call session control function whose address is stored at the gateway.

claim.body: which the gateway is a general packet radio service support node (GGSN).

content: , in which the gateway is a general packet radio service support node (GGSN).

claim-text.content: 5. A method of facilitating recovery from a failure of a proxy call session control function within an IP multimedia subsystem network, the method comprising the steps of:

monitoring, in a gateway of a packet switched access network used by a user equipment to access the IP multimedia subsystem network, signals arriving at the gateway from the proxy call session control function;
providing an indication in the gateway if the monitored signals become unacceptable; and

performing an action in the gateway, in response to the indication, which signals the unavailability of the proxy call session control function to the user equipment which is associated with the proxy call session control function;

wherein the monitoring step comprises sending to the proxy call session control function a signal requiring the proxy call session control function to send a response to the gateway and the providing step provides the indication in response to failure to receive, at the gateway, a predetermined number of responses;
wherein the response requiring signal is sent if signal traffic between the gateway and the proxy call session control function is below a predetermined level.
6. A method of facilitating recovery from a failure of a proxy call session control function within an IP multimedia subsystem network, the method comprising the steps of:

monitoring, in a gateway of a packet switched access network used by a user equipment to access the IP multimedia subsystem network, signals arriving at the gateway from the proxy call session control function;
providing an indication in the gateway if the monitored signals become unacceptable; and

performing an action in the gateway, in response to the indication, which signals the unavailability of the proxy call session control function to the user equipment which is associated with the proxy call session control function;
wherein the gateway is a gateway support node for a general packet radio service; and
wherein the action performing step comprises performing the action by means of session management signaling.

claim.body: which the action comprises removing traffic flow templates corresponding to the signaling IP flows to the user equipment.

content: , in which the action comprises removing traffic flow templates corresponding to the signaling IP flows to the user equipment.

claim.body: which the action comprises deleting a PDP context carrying signaling IP flows to the user equipment.

content: , in which the action comprises deleting a PDP context carrying signaling IP flows to the user equipment.

claim.body: which the action comprises sending notification in GPRS session management.

content: , in which the action comprises sending notification in GPRS session management.

claim.body: which the action comprises sending an ICMP message indicating that the destination IP address is unreachable.

content: , in which the action comprises sending an ICMP message indicating that the destination IP address is unreachable.

claim.body: which the action comprises informing the user equipment of which proxy call session control functions are available.

content: , in which the action comprises informing the user equipment of which proxy call session control functions are available.

claim.claim_preamble: A general packet radio service support node (GGSN)

claim-text.content: 12. A general packet radio service support node (GGSN) within a packet switched access network to allow a user equipment to access an IP multimedia subsystem network, the GGSN comprising:
an input for receiving signals arriving from a proxy call session control function (P-CSCF);
means for monitoring the signals received from the proxy call session control function;
means for providing an indication if the monitored signals become unacceptable; and

means for performing an action, in response to the indication, which signals the unavailability of the proxy call session control function to the user equipment which is associated with the proxy call session control function;
wherein the providing means provides the indication in response to an interruption in the monitored signals;
wherein the providing means provides the indication after a predetermined delay from receipt of the monitored signals; and
wherein the predetermined delay is a function of signal traffic level from the user equipment via the gateway intended for the proxy call session control function.

claim.claim_preamble: A general packet radio service support node (GGSN)

claim-text.content: 13. A general packet radio service support node (GGSN) within a packet switched access network to allow a user equipment to access an IP multimedia subsystem network, the GGSN comprising:
an input for receiving signals arriving from a proxy call session control function;
a processor; and
a memory that stores processor-executable instructions where the processor interfaces with the memory and executes the processor-executable instructions to perform operations as follows:
monitor the signals received from the proxy call session control function;
provide an indication if the monitored signals become unacceptable; and

perform an action, in response to the indication, which signals the unavailability of the proxy call session control function to the user equipment which is associated with the proxy call session control function;
wherein the indication is provided in response to an interruption in the monitored signals;
wherein the indication is provided after a predetermined delay from receipt of the monitored signals; and
wherein the predetermined delay is a function of signal traffic level from the user equipment via the gateway intended for the proxy call session control function.

claim.body:
recovery from a failure of a proxy call session control function (P-CSCF) within an Internet Protocol (IP) multimedia subsystem network, the method implemented by a general packet radio service support node (GGSN) comprising the steps of:
monitoring, in the GGSN of a packet switched access network used by a plurality of user equipment to access the IP multimedia subsystem network, IP packet flows between the P-CSCF and the plurality of user equipments which are associated with the P-CSCF, wherein the monitoring step comprises following steps:
determining that the P-CSCF has failed when the GGSN monitors an Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) error message indicating that an address of the P-CSCF is unreachable; and
determining the IP packet flows from the P-CSCF to the plurality of user equipment are interrupted for a period of time;

providing an indication in the GGSN if the monitored IP packet flows indicate an unavailability of the P-CSCF; and
performing an action in the GGSN, in response to the indication, which signals the unavailability of the P-CSCF to the plurality of user equipments which are associated with the P-CSCF.

determining that the P-CSCF has failed when the GGSN monitors an Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) error message indicating that an address of the P-CSCF is unreachable; and
determining the IP packet flows from the P-CSCF to the plurality of user equipment are interrupted for a period of time;
providing an indication in the GGSN if the monitored IP packet flows indicate an unavailability of the P-CSCF; and
performing an action in the GGSN, in response to the indication, which signals the unavailability of the P-CSCF to the plurality of user equipments which are associated with the P-CSCF.

a processor; and

determine that the P-CSCF has failed when the GGSN monitors an Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) error message indicating that an address of the P-CSCF is unreachable; and
determine the IP packet flows from the P-CSCF to the plurality of user equipment are interrupted for a period of time;

claim.claim_preamble: A general packet radio service support node (GGSN)

claim-text.content: 15. A general packet radio service support node (GGSN) of a packet switch access network used by a plurality of user equipment for facilitating recovery from a failure of a proxy call session control function (P-CSCF) within an Internet Protocol (IP) multimedia subsystem network, the GGSN comprising:
a processor; and
a memory that stores processor-executable instructions where the processor interfaces with the memory and executes the processor-executable instructions to perform operations as follows:
monitor IP packet flows between the P-CSCF and the plurality of user equipment which are associated with the P-CSCF, wherein the monitor operation comprises following:
determine that the P-CSCF has failed when the GGSN monitors an Internet Control Message Protocol (ICMP) error message indicating that an address of the P-CSCF is unreachable; and
determine the IP packet flows from the P-CSCF to the plurality of user equipment are interrupted for a period of time;
provide an indication in the GGSN if the monitored IP packet flows indicate an unavailability of the P-CSCF; and
perform an action in the GGSN, in response to the indication, which signals the unavailability of the P-CSCF to the plurality of user equipment which are associated with the P-CSCF.

claim.body:
recovery from a failure of a proxy call session control function (P-CSCF) within an Internet Protocol (IP) multimedia subsystem network, the method implemented by a general packet radio service support node (GGSN) comprising the steps of:
monitoring, in the GGSN of a packet switched access network used by a user equipment to access the IP multimedia subsystem network, an IP packet flow between the P-CSCF and the user equipment which is associated with the P-CSCF, wherein the monitoring step comprises:
periodically sending an IP packet to the P-CSCF, where the IP packet is arranged to require a response from the P-CSCF back to the GGSN;

providing an indication in the GGSN if the P-CSCF failed to send one or more response IP packets in response to the periodically sent one or more IP packets which indicates an unavailability of the P-CSCF; and
performing an action in the GGSN, in response to the indication, which signals the unavailability of the P-CSCF to the user equipment which is associated with the P-CSCF.

periodically sending an IP packet to the P-CSCF, where the IP packet is arranged to require a response from the P-CSCF back to the GGSN;

providing an indication in the GGSN if the P-CSCF failed to send one or more response IP packets in response to the periodically sent one or more IP packets which indicates an unavailability of the P-CSCF; and
performing an action in the GGSN, in response to the indication, which signals the unavailability of the P-CSCF to the user equipment which is associated with the P-CSCF.
